title: Trump’s Security Strategy Focuses on Profit, Not Spreading Democracy
summary: President Trump’s new National Security Strategy describes a country that is focused on doing business and reducing migration while avoiding passing judgment on authoritarians.

title: U.S. Warns of Europe’s ‘Civilizational Erasure’ Through Immigration
summary: America’s goal should be “to help Europe correct its current trajectory,” the administration said in its new National Security Strategy.

title: Supreme Court Agrees to Review Trump Order Restricting Birthright Citizenship
summary: The administration asked the justices to uphold an executive order ending birthright citizenship after lower courts ruled it violated the Constitution.

title: The Supreme Court, Once Wary of Partisan Gerrymandering, Goes All In
summary: The court’s conservative majority said that Texas’ asserted political motives justified letting the state use voting maps meant to disadvantage Democrats in the midterms.

title: Frank Gehry, the Disrupter, Opened Their Imaginations
summary: Architects, artists, clients and partners assess his life and impact over eight decades.

title: Frank O. Gehry, Titan of Architecture, Is Dead at 96
summary: He burst onto the scene with an attention-getting renovation of his Southern California home before going on to design some of the world’s most recognizable buildings.

title: Frank Gehry: 12 Essential, Stunning Projects
summary: A singular genius, Gehry redefined architecture with joyful buildings like the Walt Disney Concert Hall in Los Angeles and the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao.

title: Running Out of Time, Republicans in Congress Still Lack a Health Plan
summary: Top Republicans have said they want to produce a proposal in short order to counter Democrats pressing for an extension of health care subsidies. They have not gotten far.

title: As Bongino Celebrates Arrest in Pipe Bomb Case, Others on the Right Remain Skeptical
summary: Some activists have lashed out, in a reprise of the backlash over the unsuccessful effort by Trump appointees to shut down the Epstein investigation.

title: C.D.C. Vaccine Committee Ends Recommendation That All Newborns Receive Hepatitis B Shots
summary: In a move toward Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s goal of upending vaccine policy, the committee recommended delaying the shots for infants whose mothers test negative for the virus.

title: Halligan Continues as U.S. Attorney, Prompting Criticism From Judges
summary: The Justice Department has seized on a lack of explicit instruction from a federal judge to keep Lindsey Halligan in place for now.

title: Elon Musk Loves What Mario Nawfal Has to Say
summary: Mario Nawfal has a knack for getting Mr. Musk’s attention online, and for turning that into big business.

title: Lots of Oil, Little Production: What to Know About Venezuelan Energy
summary: The South American country increasingly at odds with the Trump administration has the world’s largest oil reserves.

title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros in $83 Billion Deal
summary: The deal to acquire the Hollywood behemoth’s television and film studios as well as HBO Max will bulk up the world’s biggest paid streaming service.

title: Netflix Changes Course Again With Warner Bros. Deal
summary: The streaming giant has changed its strategy many times over the years. But the decision to get deeply into theatrical releases may be the most startling yet.

title: CNN Is Excluded From Netflix’s Warner Bros. Deal for Now
summary: The prospect of Paramount’s buying Warner Bros. Discovery had led CNN journalists to wonder if the channel may be combined with CBS News. Instead, CNN will remain in a separate corporate entity.

title: Rich New Yorkers Threaten to Leave. Then They Find Out How Hard That Is.
summary: Tax accountants and lawyers detail the arduous process wealthy New Yorkers would have to face to avoid paying New York State and city taxes.

title: Mamdani Woos Wealthy Donors Alongside Grassroots Givers for Transition
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani has turned to crypto kings, movie stars and an oil heir, among others, to help reach his $4 million goal to fund his transition and Jan. 1 inauguration.

title: San Diego to Pay $30 Million to Family of Konoa Wilson, Teen Killed by Police
summary: Konoa Wilson was 16 when he was fatally shot. The settlement, one of the largest in a police killing, surpasses the $27 million paid to the family of George Floyd.

title: Olivia Nuzzi and Vanity Fair Will Part Ways
summary: Condé Nast, the magazine’s parent company, said her contract would expire at the end of the year.

title: How Kit Kat Was Killed: Video Shows What a Waymo Couldn’t See
summary: Surveillance video shows a woman crouching beside a Waymo self-driving taxi, trying to lure a beloved neighborhood cat to safety. A second later, the car drove off.

title: Versace Announces Dario Vitale’s Shocking Departure
summary: After one hit collection, the designer Dario Vitale will be leaving the brand. What’s going on?

title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Could Be Illegal
summary: Once nativism escalates, it’s hard to stop.

title: The One Child Policy’s Legacy: A Surplus of Single Men
summary: A decade after the end of the one-child policy, China has over 30 million so-called surplus men. Can this dating boot camp help them find love?

title: Justices to Review Trump’s Order Restricting Birthright Citizenship
summary: Also, the celebrated architect Frank Gehry dies at 96. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.

title: How Batteries Got Cheaper and Made the Electric Grid More Reliable
summary: An early grid battery was installed in the Atacama Desert in Chile 15 years ago. Now, as prices have tumbled, they are increasingly being used around the world.

title: Biden Says Republicans Aim to Turn L.G.B.T.Q. Identity Into ‘Something Scary’
summary: The former president defended his support for transgender rights, a stance that has provoked second-guessing among some Democrats.

title: At the National Archives, a Deep Dive Into the American Story
summary: A new $40-million exhibit, opening nine months after President Trump fired the chief archivist, uses technology to explore the 13 billion-plus items in its vaults.

title: Post-Trump, What Happens to His War Chest? Utah Offers One Clue.
summary: A Trump-aligned political group is quietly spending millions to help state Republicans have a friendlier House map in 2028 — not in 2026, as with all of his other redistricting efforts.
